name: slurping
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
slurp
[ I or T ] informal to drink a liquid noisily as a result of sucking air into the mouth at the same time as the liquid: Try not to slurp. I wish you wouldn't slurp your soup like that. He slurped down his coffee.

[ I ] UK informal When a thick liquid slurps, it makes loud noises: The lava slurped and bubbled down the mountainside.
